# xPath

**Instance Property**

Returns the XPath expression identifying the receiver’s location in the document tree.

## Declaration

```swift
var xPath: String? { get }
```

## Discussion

For example, this method might return a string such as “foo/bar[2]/baz”. The result of this method can be used directly in the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode/nodes(forXPath:)] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode/objects(forXQuery:constants:)] methods.

## Executing Queries

- **nodes(forXPath:)**: Returns the nodes resulting from executing an XPath query upon the receiver.
- **objects(forXQuery:)**: Returns the objects resulting from executing an XQuery query upon the receiver.
- **objects(forXQuery:constants:)**: Returns the objects resulting from executing an XQuery query upon the receiver.
